Why did police not charge Epsom Girls Grammar School music teacher Peter Thomas after sex with student? https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/why-did-police-not-charge-epsom-girls-grammar-school-music-teacher-peter-thomas-after-sex-with-student/EWODNQCV6FBYZGJI7BQHL6BVGM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/why-did-police-not-charge-epsom-girls-grammar-school-music-teacher-peter-thomas-after-sex-with-student/EWODNQCV6FBYZGJI7BQHL6BVGM/ Lane Nichols'He’s groomed her to the point where she has been unable to say no', the advocate claims. Tue, 24 Sep 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Former Epsom Girls Grammar School music teacher Peter Thomas has been censured and struck off for having sex with one of his students.

End of working from home? Employment law expert’s advice on WFH changes as Government cracks down https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/end-of-working-from-home-employment-law-experts-advice-on-wfh-changes-as-government-cracks-down/UG56W7FJN5EHFAJSLZ4O7ZNY7I/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/end-of-working-from-home-employment-law-experts-advice-on-wfh-changes-as-government-cracks-down/UG56W7FJN5EHFAJSLZ4O7ZNY7I/ Raphael FranksWhat rights do employees have if their boss calls them back to the office? Tue, 24 Sep 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Office workers ordered to stop working from home may have no choice but to follow their bosses’ orders, an employment law expert says - but it will depend on contractual arrangements. Photo / 123RF
Hastings vape store sold two single cigarettes for $5 to customers who knew the code https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/hastings-vape-story-sold-two-single-香烟-for-5-to-customers-who-knew-the-code/ 3WLJILQ3XNGHJICEL6UPOXIWIU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/hastings-vape-story-sold-two-single-香烟-for-5-to-customers-who-knew-the-code/ 3WLJILQ3XNGHJICEL6UPOXIWIU/ Doug LaingAn undercover agent used the code, leading to a prosecution and thousands in fines. Tue, 24 Sep 2024 18:00:00 +0000 The Discount vape and tobacco store in Hastings, where two loose cigarettes were sold for $40. Single cigarette sales are illegal and the shop owner and an employee were fined a total of $8000 for the offences and related offending. Photo / Chris Hyde

Facial recognition tech cuts serious assaults by 130 in Foodstuffs North Island stores https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/facial-recognition-tech-cuts-serious-assaults-by-130-in-foodstuffs-north-island-stores/R4FKTAPEANFLPL3LU3P434J6F4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/facial-recognition-tech-cuts-serious-assaults-by-130-in-foodstuffs-north-island-stores/R4FKTAPEANFLPL3LU3P434J6F4/ Early results indicate 130 incidences of serious assaults and verbal abuse were avoided. Tue, 24 Sep 2024 19:53:35 +0000 Facial recognition technology at 25 supermarkets has reduced crime and prevented more than 100 serious physical and verbal assaults, according to Foodstuffs. Photo / 123RF
Start with a sugar tax to help feed the cash-strapped Beehive monster: Ryan Bridge https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/start-with-a-sugar-tax-to-help-feed-the-cash-strapped-beehive-monster-ryan-bridge/OI7WQVS3TFCE5AC5QPILR3LAJE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/start-with-a-sugar-tax-to-help-feed-the-cash-strapped-beehive-monster-ryan-bridge/OI7WQVS3TFCE5AC5QPILR3LAJE/ Ryan BridgeOPINION: Tax is like a cancer eating away at your hard work. Photo / Catherine Hutton
